title: Selecting Safe Plants in Radioactive Areas
brief: Priority order for selecting and preparing plant foods in fallout-contaminated areas.
steps: Step 1: First choice - underground vegetables (potatoes, turnips, carrots). Scrub thoroughly and remove all skin.
Step 2: Second choice - fruits/vegetables you can wash and peel (bananas, apples, tomatoes, prickly pears).
Step 3: Third choice - smooth-skinned plants that cannot be peeled. Wash thoroughly (removes 90% contamination).
Step 4: Last resort only - rough-surfaced plants (lettuce, dried fruits). Washing removes only 50% contamination.
Step 5: Avoid growing plants that may have absorbed radioactive materials through leaves and roots.
warnings: Never eat rough-surfaced plants unless facing starvation
Avoid plants that were growing during or after fallout period
Cannot effectively decontaminate dried fruits or soya beans
